formattedAddress: 406 W 31st St, New York, NY 10001, USA
adrFormatAddress: 406 W 31st St, New York, NY 10001, USA

originalText.text: No street parking but dorms and college life are good. Easily accessible to public transportation and several markets/clothing stores

text.text: No street parking but dorms and college life are good. Easily accessible to public transportation and several markets/clothing stores

originalText.text: I pretty much never write reviews but I’m staying here for the summer and I don’t recommend. The walls are thin as hell. The kitchen is outdated. The neighborhood is noisy (more than NY noisy, it’s NY construction from 1-6am noisy). The bathrooms smell like sewage. They don’t let you move in at the start date (even though you’re paying for that period) and claim that they have to “prepare the room” for you. They explicitly said it was being cleaned but the rooms are dirty. I deep cleaned it when I moved in and it was gross. There are also absolutely no refunds. Like I said, I don’t recommend.

originalText.text: Do not ever live here, there are so many absurd rules about overnight visitation and honestly they look for ways to steal your money. If you put $20 of credit on your laundry card, you only $15 to use on laundry. The school eats that last 5 dollars. Want to have an overnight guest? You better have them sign in the day before before 4 pm. Is there an emergency and your friend wants to sleep on your floor for a night at the last minute? No problem, just be ready for the $50 fine. Want to go to the gym? Okay, but they're only open for three hours in the morning and three hours at night. Hope that works with your work schedule! Want to pick up mail? Okay, the mailroom is only open 9-6. Oh, you work 9-7 every day? sucks.

originalText.text: Let me preface this by saying I do not live here, but often visit someone who does live here for the summer. Words cannot describe how horrendous this money-grabbing scheme of a system is. I just had to pre-register myself as an overnight guest and was immediately slapped in the face with a request to pay $10 via PayPal to FIT. You are a public institution, why do you need 10 f***ing dollars? The staff at this place are some of the most unfriendly, miserable, and oftentimes downright rudest people I have had to deal with. I chose to live at NYU for the summer, and my interactions and experiences at FIT make NYU feel like the Ritz-Carlton. Not to mention, the neighborhood of Kaufman Hall is not the safest and is by far one of the most vile and chaotic areas in Midtown. I cannot stress enough how much I despise this place. Once again, all this is coming from someone who doesn't even live here.

originalText.text: I live here, it's pretty nice. Has a mail room, fitness room, laundry room, and vending machines. The ceilings in the dorm are high up.
